intro: Lithocardium convolvuliflorum, commonly known as the rock heart vine, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has adapted to harsh environments with its succulent leaves and deep root system, allowing it to store water efficiently. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-like species. Lithocardium convolvuliflorum is often found growing on rocky outcrops and in dry, sandy soils.
